channel.title: Java: Getting Started
channel.description: Hello, I have the book "Sams Teach Yourself Java 6 in 21 Days" I was wondering if any of you have read this book and know if it's any good. I'm looking to learn the language faster than the book intends you do; so I was hoping some of you could shed some light on whether or not this book is a good one to start off with or if it's a dud, thank you and please post. :)

item.title: Java: Getting Started
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:11, topic:220917”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=290078.msg2340170#msg2340170 date=1216293153]

  • for Dummies, * in 21 days etc any of those type are all shit.

Personally, books won’t teach you much. Use the tutorials on the sun Java site.
[/quote]Yes they will…[/quote]
No, they won’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Java: Getting Started
item.dc:creator: @DonnyB4e56 DonnyB4e56
item.description:
@DonnyB4e56 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:9, topic:220917”][quote author=DonnyB4e56 link=topic=290078.msg2341516#msg2341516 date=1216370558]
I know there is Eclipse and NetBeans for Ubuntu Linux (wich is what im regretfully using) but rite now im using Geany, and it seems to be working out well for the trials. So im going to ditch the book and try your suggestion and do the tutorials on the site, thank you all for your reply’s.
[/quote]
You’re welcome. I am not discouraging the use of books, but from my past experience, it’s not fun/can be learned a lot quicker from perhaps practicality use of the tutorials.[/quote]

What do you mean by “a lot quicker”? I can learn the language in under 21 days with the tutorials?

Read full topic

You’re welcome. I am not discouraging the use of books, but from my past experience, it’s not fun/can be learned a lot quicker from perhaps practicality use of the tutorials.

item.title: Java: Getting Started
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I got to page 101 on the “Java for dummies” ebook and thought “wat”. If your going to learn, skim through the tutorial looking at the code examples on the official Java tutorials, then recreate the code examples, I found it much easier learning by trial and error than learning by someone telling me their experiences with trial and error. Eclipse or Netbeans really make life easier when your starting out.

Read full topic

item.title: Java: Getting Started
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“DonnyB4e56, post:4, topic:220917”][quote author=Tree link=topic=290078.msg2340172#msg2340172 date=1216293267]

Hello, I have the book “Sams Teach Yourself Java 6 in 21 Days” I was wondering if any of you have read this book and know if it’s any good. I’m looking to learn the language faster than the book intends you do; so I was hoping some of you could shed some light on whether or not this book is a good one to start off with or if it’s a dud, thank you and please post.

It’s not possible to learn the language in 21 days completely. Think of the book as a starting block for something more. It will run you through the basics will will enable you to improve from then on. So will it do you good? Perhaps. People learn in many different ways. I remember having to read through a massive amount of ebooks before i got anything. It was boring and repetitive but worth it all the way.

Go down to the public library and get out every book you can see. Read each one and pick the most boring of them. Study them. If they are slightly uninteresting, then chances are they are slightly more informing. Just stick to it.
[/quote]

Thanks, I’ll do that. :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 17, 2008, 12:22:41 AM[/size][hr][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=290078.msg2340170#msg2340170 date=1216293153]

  • for Dummies, * in 21 days etc any of those type are all shit.

Personally, books won’t teach you much. Use the tutorials on the sun Java site.
[/quote]

How did you go about learning the Java language? The tutorial son the Sun Java site?[/quote]
Yep.

Read full topic

I remember having to read through a massive amount of ebooks before i got anything. It was boring and repetitive but worth it all the way.

item.title: Java: Getting Started
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

DonnyB4e56:

Hello, I have the book “Sams Teach Yourself Java 6 in 21 Days” I was wondering if any of you have read this book and know if it’s any good. I’m looking to learn the language faster than the book intends you do; so I was hoping some of you could shed some light on whether or not this book is a good one to start off with or if it’s a dud, thank you and please post.

It’s not possible to learn the language in 21 days completely. Think of the book as a starting block for something more. It will run you through the basics will will enable you to improve from then on. So will it do you good? Perhaps. People learn in many different ways. I remember having to read through a massive amount of ebooks before i got anything. It was boring and repetitive but worth it all the way.

Go down to the public library and get out every book you can see. Read each one and pick the most boring of them. Study them. If they are slightly uninteresting, then chances are they are slightly more informing. Just stick to it.
